com.soa.policy.wspolicy
Interface EffectivePolicyFactory

All Superinterfaces:
PolicyConstants
public interface EffectivePolicyFactory
extends PolicyConstants

IEffectivePolicyFactory implementation based on WS-Policy and WS-PolicyAttachment. The policies must be nested within wsp:Policy elements and attached to the WSDL document.

Since:
3.1

Field Summary
 
Fields inherited from interface com.soa.policy.wspolicy.PolicyConstants

Method Detail

calculateEffectivePolicy

Policy calculateEffectivePolicy(javax.wsdl.Definition definition,
                                javax.xml.namespace.QName serviceName,
                                java.lang.String portName,
                                java.lang.String operationName,
                                ParameterType parameter,
                                java.lang.String messageName,
                                PolicyVisibility visibility)
                                throws GException
Calculates the effective policy for a specified message. The policies are merged based on scope according to the WS-PolicyAttachment specification. Supports policy in the following WSDL areas:
1. Policy within a port (service / port)
2. Policy within an operation (binding / operation)
3. Policy within an input, output, fault message
(binding / operation / input, output, fault)
4. Policy within an operation (portType / operation)
Policy found within each of these areas are merged together and normalized. Policy in the form of Policy elements is local to the WSDL and generally placed as children of the definitions element, though attachment under specific WSDL elements is also supported. PolicyReference is the preferred way to attach policy to WSDL elements, and PolicyReference's nested within policy attached to WSDL elements is also supported.

Parameters:
definition - WSDL Definition.
serviceName - QName of the service to calculate for.
portName - Name of the port to calculate for.
operationName - Name of the operation to calculate for. Optional.
parameter - Indicates whether for IN, OUT, or FAULT. Optional.
messageName - Name of the message. Only needed if parameter is FAULT.
visibility - PolicyVisibility used to find policies.
Returns:
Policy holding the effective policy.
Throws:
GException - Thrown if unable to calculate the effective policy. Possibly caused by an invalid policy or conflicting policies.

calculateEffectivePolicy

Policy calculateEffectivePolicy(javax.wsdl.Definition definition,
                                javax.xml.namespace.QName serviceName,
                                java.lang.String portName,
                                java.lang.String operationName,
                                ParameterType parameter,
                                java.lang.String messageName,
                                PolicyVisibility visibility,
                                java.lang.Object initialPolicy)
                                throws GException
Calculates the effective policy for a specified message. The policies are merged based on scope according to the WS-PolicyAttachment specification. Supports policy in the following WSDL areas:
1. Policy within a port (service / port)
2. Policy within an operation (binding / operation)
3. Policy within an input, output, fault message
(binding / operation / input, output, fault)
4. Policy within an operation (portType / operation)
Policy found within each of these areas are merged together and normalized. Policy in the form of Policy elements is local to the WSDL and generally placed as children of the definitions element, though attachment under specific WSDL elements is also supported. PolicyReference is the preferred way to attach policy to WSDL elements, and PolicyReference's nested within policy attached to WSDL elements is also supported.

Parameters:
definition - WSDL Definition.
serviceName - QName of the service to calculate for.
portName - Name of the port to calculate for.
operationName - Name of the operation to calculate for. Optional.
parameter - Indicates whether for IN, OUT, or FAULT. Optional.
messageName - Name of the message. Only needed if parameter is FAULT.
visibility - PolicyVisibility used to find policies.
initialPolicy - Policy to merge with the calculated effective policy. May be null, a com.soa.policy.wspolicy.Policy, or an org.w3c.dom.Element.
Returns:
Policy holding the effective policy.
Throws:
GException - Thrown if unable to calculate the effective policy. Possibly caused by an invalid policy or conflicting policies.

calculateEffectivePolicy

Policy calculateEffectivePolicy(javax.wsdl.Definition definition,
                                javax.xml.namespace.QName serviceName,
                                javax.xml.namespace.QName portTypeName,
                                java.lang.String operationName,
                                ParameterType parameter,
                                java.lang.String messageName,
                                PolicyVisibility visibility)
                                throws GException
Calculates the effective policy for a specified message. The policies are merged based on scope according to the WS-PolicyAttachment specification. Supports policy in the following WSDL areas:
1. Policy within a service
2. Policy within an operation (binding / operation)
3. Policy within an input, output, fault message
(binding / operation / input, output, fault)
4. Policy within an operation (portType / operation)
Policy found within each of these areas are merged together and normalized. Policy in the form of Policy elements is local to the WSDL and generally placed as children of the definitions element, though attachment under specific WSDL elements is also supported. PolicyReference is the preferred way to attach policy to WSDL elements, and PolicyReference's nested within policy attached to WSDL elements is also supported.

Parameters:
definition - WSDL Definition.
serviceName - QName of the service to calculate for.
portTypeName - Name of the port type (interface) to calculate for.
operationName - Name of the operation to calculate for. Optional.
parameter - Indictates whether for IN, OUT, or FAULT. Optional.
messageName - Name of the message. Only needed if parameter is FAULT.
visibility - PolicyVisibility used to find policies.
Returns:
Policy holding the effective policy.
Throws:
GException - Thrown if unable to calculate the effective policy. Possibly caused by an invalid policy or conflicting policies.

4. Policy within an operation (portType / operation)
Policy found within each of these areas are merged together and normalized. PolicyReference is the preferred way to attach policy to WSDL elements, and PolicyReference's nested within policy attached to WSDL elements is also supported.

Parameters:
definition - WSDL Definition.
serviceName - QName of the service to calculate for.

visibility - PolicyVisibility used to find policies.
